Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the class I bacteriocin
Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Comments: Streptolysin S (SLS) is a bacteriocin-like haemolytic and cytotoxic virulence factor that plays a key role in the virulence of Group A Streptococcus(GAS). The peptide contributes to the cytotoxicity, inflammatory activation and polymorphonuclear neutrophil (PMN) resistance of GAS, thereby playing a role in necrosis and systemic spread. It is also responsible for the associated characteristic beta-haemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: Listeriolysin S, a novel peptide haemolysin associated with a subset of lineage I Listeria monocytogenes.
Literature.Author: Cotter PD, Draper LA, Lawton EM, Daly KM, Groeger DS, Casey PG, Ross RP, Hill C.
